items.content_html:
Overview pages usually don't have browser-compat section; this one was not working.

I replaced the key in YAML so that the spec section works.

Also, I fixed a bit of grammar (and removed a "new" that didn't age well – Wasm is no more new)
items.title: Remove non-working browser compat section from the Wasm landing page

items.content_html:
This page is fairly old: it predates the migration to GitHub.

No browser implements it:

  • no trace in AudioWorkletProcessor.webidl for Firefox
  • no trace in Chromium AudioWorkletProcessor.idl (That uses WebKit implementation I think)
  • no mention in the spec: https://webaudio.github.io/web-audio-api/#AudioWorkletProcessor

This looks like an ancient abandoned proposal—no need to keep it.
items.title: Remove non-existent AudioWorkletProcessor.paramterDescriptors

items.content_html: The link was broken, and it is now evident that it works with "multiprocess firefox".
items.title: Remove an outdated sentence

items.content_html: multipart is not a member of XMLHttpRequest. Don't think it is worth a glossary entry.
items.title: Remove incorrect link

items.content_html: Even if we want to refactor this example in the future, there is no reason to keep this broken link.
items.title: Remove link to XUL

items.content_html: This was an autolink to the same page. That event is bubbling, and we document them only on the EventTarget.
items.title: Remove link to the same event higher in the bubbling chain

items.content_html: There were a few links left to this old deleted page. I removed them. ECMAScript for XML is long gone.
items.title: Remove links to E4X

items.content_html:
URL.createObjectURL() is a static method that is not specific to MSE. (In fact it is part of the File API).

Removing it from this sidebar.
items.title: [GroupData] Remove entry from Media Source Extensions APi

items.content_html:
Part of openwebdocs/project#185

The page is outdated:

  • some parts are no more relevant (prefixing onXYZ with Window)
  • the rest already explained in the Learning Area (I redirect to it)

And the page is not accessible when navigating from the main page and can't be found by readers.
items.title: Delete Writing Forward-compatible websites

items.content_html:
Part of openwebdocs/project#185

Both pages had the same content (= same macro!).
items.title: Redirect Web/Guide/API to Web/API

items.content_html: The pointer_up event's target is the element and it bubbles up to the document. So I fixed the link (the code is correct).
items.title: Fix link to the pointer_up event

items.content_html:
Starting a new test, Getting the document you want to test, Interacting with the document and Testing your element.

Description

The code in the Starting a new test, Getting the document you want to test, Interacting with the document and Testing your element sections were updated so that users can accomplish what is mentioned in them. The previous code was not producing the desired results. Popup interaction and the ability to add text into one of the form elements mentioned in the Testing your element section was not producing the desired results.

Motivation

To allow readers to understand how to accomplish what is mentioned in the Starting a new test, Getting the document you want to test, Interacting with the document and Testing your element sections.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: updated the code in the four sections mentioned below:

items.content_html:
Description

This MDN document does not:

  • disambiguate between ARIA versions,
  • cover ARIA changes across versions,
  • address the fact that ARIA itself is silent on "ARIA annotations",
  • nor does it mention the unmaintained ARIA Annotations draft specification.

Motivation

This page has been causing confusion for months, causing some recent internal client documentation to assert this is a "feature of ARIA 1.3", and citing only this page as evidence.
items.title: Clarify ARIA versions, the other spec

items.content_html:

other small update

items.title: some update to Battery Status API

items.content_html:
Please refer to the IEEE Standard 754 for floating-point encoding.

Description

The example on the page is incorrect for both systems (little and big endian).
A number in JS is encoded to become:
SEEEEEEEEEEEMMMMMMMMM...MMM
S : sign bit
E : 11 exponent bits
M : 52 Mantissa bits

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Correcting a code example

items.content_html:
Description

normalize Pointer Events GroupData to use Element rather then HTMLElement, and add Element: pointerrawupdate and Element.hasPointerCapture()

add See also section for Pointer Events API summary page

add Pointer Events section for interface summary page

fix PointerEvent.altitudeAngle and PointerEvent.azimuthAngle property name

add {{secureContext_header}} for PointerEvent.getCoalescedEvents() and Element/pointerrawupdate_event

insert Element/pointerrawupdate_event PointerEvent.altitudeAngle PointerEvent.azimuthAngle to list

some other update

Motivation

Additional details

reference to https://w3c.github.io/pointerevents/
working on https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Pointer_events

items.content_html:
Description

This PR adds the following "border image" section and subsections to Learn area's "CSS building blocks" about "Backgrounds and borders":

### Border images

#### Specifying the border image
#### Slicing the border image
#### Adjusting the width of the border image
#### Extending the border image beyond the border
#### Controlling the layout of the border image
#### Using the `border-image` shorthand property

This PR also edits a few existing subsection headings for consistency.

Motivation

This is part of Interop 2023 work.

Related issues and pull requests

Doc issue tracker: mdn/mdn#416
items.title: docs(learn): Add border image information to Learn area

items.content_html:
This PR fixes the examples for the ::webkit-meter-* selectors by performing the following:

  • Programmatically check for Safari with JavaScript to set -webkit-appearance: none
    • Setting -webkit-appearance: none breaks rendering in Chrome, so it has to be programmatically set now (Chrome used to not support the -webkit- prefix)
  • Update the fallback texts of the meters to better represent what the value of the meter is
  • For comparison purposes, make two versions of the meters: one normal and one styled
    • Doing so helps show what is actually changed in styling
  • Fix the attributes of the <meter> elements to reflect what the example is actually supposed to demonstrate

Additionally, this fixes some of the summary text for accuracy.
items.title: Fix examples for ::-webkit-meter-* selectors

items.content_html:

items.title: CSS counter() function
